thread.title: Man arrested for kicking pregnant woman in the stomach on subway
thread.title_full: Man arrested for kicking pregnant woman in the stomach on subway | New York Post

author: Larry Celona
title: Man arrested for kicking pregnant woman in the stomach on subway
text:
A 9-months-pregnant woman got bumped by a rider on a crowded lower Manhattan subway train Thursday and defensively pushed him away — so he retaliated by kicking her twice in the stomach, cops said.
The 28-year-old victim was riding the northbound train near the Bowling Green station around 11:30 a.m. when Michael Lee, 40, of Staten Island bumped into her and she confronted him, cops said.
“It was a crowded train and the guy bumped into her,” NYPD spokesman Sgt. Lee Jones said. “She mentioned something to him.”
The two then got into an argument that turned physical when the woman pushed the man to the floor — and he viciously retaliated.
“He got back up and kicked her twice in the stomach,” Jones said.
Cops arrested Lee at the Bowling Green station and charged him with assault.
The woman was rushed to New York-Presbyterian Hospital. Her condition was not immediately known.
